unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Intensify Ahead of Festive Season**
normalised: manufacturing and supply chain vendor audits intensify ahead of festive season

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – Manufacturing firms across India are ramping up vendor audits in anticipation of increased demand during the upcoming festive season. A recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) indicates a 20% increase in audit activity compared to last year.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – manufacturing firms across India are ramping up vendor audits in anticipation of increased demand during the upcoming festive season. A recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry (C I I) indicates a twenty percent increase in audit activity compared to last year.

unnormalised: The audits, focusing on quality control and ethical sourcing, are particularly crucial for companies producing fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) and electronics. Several major players, including Tata Steel and Mahindra & Mahindra, are employing third-party auditors to ensure compliance across their extensive supply chains.

unnormalised: "We are seeing a heightened focus on verifying ethical labor practices and raw material sourcing, especially for food manufacturers supplying ingredients for traditional festive dishes like biryani and Onam Sadhya," stated Dr. Priya Sharma, Head of Supply Chain at Reliance Retail. Non-compliance can result in significant delays and reputational damage, potentially impacting festive sales which are projected to exceed Rs. 50,000 crore this year alone. This includes verifying adherence to ISO 9001 standards and stringent environmental regulations. Suppliers failing audits may face penalties or even contract termination. The aim is to ensure consumers receive high-quality and ethically sourced products this Diwali.
